# Recipe: Instapot Lentil Soup

## Introduction
Instapot Lentil Soup is a hearty and nutritious dish that is perfect for chilly days. This soup is packed with protein, fiber, and essential vitamins and minerals. It is a versatile recipe that can be customized with various vegetables and spices to suit your taste preferences.

## Ingredients
- 1 cup dried lentils
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh cilantro for garnish

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Measuring cups and spoons
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 25 minutes

## Steps
1. Rinse the lentils under cold water and remove any debris or stones.
2. Set the Instant Pot to sauté mode and heat a tablespoon of oil.
3. Add the diced onion, carrots, and celery to the pot. Sauté for 5 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. Add the minced garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional minute to toast the spices.
5. Press the cancel button to stop the sauté mode.
6. Add the rinsed lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth to the pot. Stir well to combine.
7. Close the Instant Pot lid and set the valve to the sealing position.
8. Select the manual or pressure cook setting and set the timer for 15 minutes.
9. Once the cooking time is complete, allow the pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then carefully do a quick release.
10. Open the Instant Pot lid and give the soup a stir. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
11. Serve the Instapot Lentil Soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the lentil soup with a side of crusty bread or warm naan bread for dipping.
- Pair it with a fresh green salad for a complete and satisfying meal.

## Variations
- Add diced potatoes or sweet potatoes for added heartiness.
- Include chopped spinach or kale for extra nutrition.
- For a spicier version, add a pinch of red pepper flakes or a dash of hot sauce.

## Tips and Tricks
- To save time, you can use pre-cooked lentils instead of dried lentils. Simply adjust the cooking time accordingly.
- If you prefer a smoother texture, use an immersion blender to partially blend the soup before serving.
- Feel free to experiment with different herbs and spices to customize the flavor profile of the soup.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information may vary depending on the specific ingredients used. Here is a general breakdown of the approximate values per serving:
  - Calories: 200
  - Fat: 1g
  - Carbohydrates: 38g
  - Fiber: 12g
  - Protein: 13g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Allow the soup to cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container.
- Store the leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
- Reheat the soup on the stovetop or in the microwave until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Can I use other types of lentils?
A: Yes, you can use green lentils, brown lentils, or even a mix of lentils for added variety.

Q: Can I make this soup on the stovetop?
A: Absolutely! Simply follow the same steps but cook the soup in a large pot on the stovetop over medium heat for approximately 30-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.

Q: Can I freeze the soup?
A: Yes, you can freeze the soup for up to 3 months. Allow it to cool completely before transferring to freezer-safe containers or bags. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
